thread.title: $1M winning lottery ticket sold in Kendallville claimed 5 hours before deadline
thread.title_full: $1M winning lottery ticket sold in Kendallville claimed 5 hours before deadline

author: @ABC21WPTA
title: $1M winning lottery ticket sold in Kendallville claimed 5 hours before deadline
text:
$1M winning lottery ticket sold in Kendallville claimed 5 hours before deadline
The winner had until 4:30 p.m. ET Thursday to claim their prize
KENDALLVILLE, Ind. (WPTA) - With five hours to spare, the couple who bought a $1 million winning lottery ticket in Kendallville claimed their prize.
The ticket, which matched all five white balls for the June 29 drawing, was bought at Kendallville Finish Line, at 620 Professional Way. The winning Powerball numbers for that drawing were: 26-51-54-61-69 with the Powerball of 25.
Upon claiming the ticket, they said it was “an emotional day” for them both.
They told Hoosier lottery officials they had seen news coverage and signage about the unclaimed ticket beginning about a month ago and began searching. The couple said they do not visit the gas station frequently and were unsure if they had purchased a ticket for that specific Powerball drawing.
The first search was unsuccessful, but on Wednesday, they woke up at 4 a.m. to search again – including deep between their car seats. There, they found their winning ticket.
All prizes must be claimed within 180 days of the drawing. Hoosier Lottery encourages those with winning tickets to ensure their ticket is in a secure place, consider meeting with a financial advisor and contact Hoosier Lottery customer service at 1-800-955-6886 for specific claim instructions.
The Powerball jackpot is an estimated $145 million for Saturday, Dec. 28. Overall odds are 1 in 25, per Hoosier Lottery.
Watch our [previous report](https://www.21alivenews.com/2024/12/07/1-million-winning-powerball-ticket-sold-kendallville-expire-soon/) below.
